snippet: One year after its acquisition by AOL, The Huffington Post has become a source of growth with several business units now in Arianna Huffington’s hands, a move intended to add sections and products faster.
abstract: Huffington Post has become a source of growth for AOL just one year after its acquisition; in what Arianna Huffington characterizes as a move to keep the Web site's growth accelerating, she has taken several of its business functions out of AOL and under her control; changes appear to give Huffington more authority within the closely watched media company, where her title is president and editor in chief of the Huffington Post Media Group.
lead_paragraph: One year after its acquisition by AOL, The Huffington Post has become a source of growth with several business units now in Arianna Huffington’s hands, a move intended to add sections and products faster.

headline.seo: Huffington Gains More Control in AOL Revamping
headline.main: Huffington Gains More Control in AOL Revamping
headline.print_headline: Huffington Gains More Control in AOL Revamping
